page.title: 19WATER IN BASSINGBOURN
page.content: {M S P Sewage wks}This plan shows ============= {S}springs where {------<---}|{<-^ }men first lived {^ }|{P ^ ^ }streams {^ } | {^ M}old moats {mill^ }|{M ^ P}disused pumps {^ } |{H ^ H}horsepond{T}trough { ^ D T+ ^P } | {+}church ===========High St=======| {^ {^ }|{P ^ M }|=={M {^ }| {^ } A14|{ ^Reservoir {Well ^ }| {^} | {S {head Spring}| S | =====================Ashwell Street=== {D}(dipping hole),{H}&{T}have now gone. The watermill worked until the 1950s. Most water is used now for irrigation. The reservoir has two boreholes 36.6m deep & holds nearly 48 million litres. {Rock }--chalk{< 10km >}chalk-- {profile}___clay____{+}__clay___ {NORTH }=======greensand======= {SOUTH
